title: Eurovision Song Contest
text:
Eurovision Song Contest
Member Broadcaster: NPB/NOS
First participation: 1956
Previous participations: 47
Best result: 1st (1957 , 1959, 1969, 1975)
Worst result: last (1958, 1962, 1963, 1968)
Official national Eurovision Song Contest website
http://www.nos.nl/songfestival/ The Netherlands at the Eurovision Song Contest The Netherlands is one of the countries that have taken part in the Eurovision Song Contest the most times. Already at the second Eurovision Song Contest in 1957, the Netherlands got their first victory. Corry BROKKEN sang the legendary Net Als Toen. Only two years later, Teddy SCHOLTEN won for the country again with the song Een Beetje. Because of the fact that the Netherlands won again in 1969 and that the group TEACH-IN won with the song Ding-A-Dong back in 1975, the country is one of the most winning countries ever in song contest history. On the contrary, the Netherlands has also failed many times, which is obvious from its many last position results. Since the victory in 1975, the Netherlands has been looking forward to its fifth victory, but it is yet still to come. Most successful entrant in the last ten years is Edsilia ROMBLEY, who came in fourth position with the stunning song Hemel En Aarde at the 1998 Eurovision Song Contest in Birmingham. Edsilia is returning this year as Dutch entrant. In 2005, Glennis GRACE was predicted to do very well with her song My Impossible Dream, but unfortunately the song did not even make it to the Final. Last year in Athens, the female band TREBLE did not make it to the final either. Therefore, the Netherlands needs a boost in order to re-experience some of its previous successful moments.
